thread.title: Bangor Uni student wins deportation appeal, MP says
thread.title_full: Bangor Uni student wins deportation appeal, MP says

title: Bangor Uni student wins deportation appeal, MP says
text:
Bangor Uni student wins deportation appeal, MP says 27 February 2017 Image copyright Shiromini Satkunarajah Image caption Shiromini Satkunarajah is described as an "exceptionally able and diligent student" A Bangor University student threatened with deportation has been told she can remain in the UK, her local MP has said. 
Shiromini Satkunarajah, 20, had been taken to a detention centre after being refused asylum. 
Bangor's vice chancellor wrote to the Home Office, after a National Union of Students (NUS) petition backing her bid to stay attracted 27,000 signatures. 
"Thank you for support," tweeted Arfon MP Hywel Williams. 
"Pleased to announce my constituent Satku Shiromini has been released tonight and decision to deport has been lifted." 
BBC Wales have contacted the Home Office for a comment.
